Title: The Way Back 
Country: USA 
USA release: 21/01/2011

DVD release (sale): 22/06/2011 
Company: Exclusive Media Group Wrekin Hill Entertainment 
Genre: Belize, Drama 
Length: 133 min 
Director: Peter Weir 
Screenplay: Peter Weir 
Starring: Ed Harris, Jim Sturgess, Saoirse Ronan, Colin Farrell, Mark Strong, Gustaf Skarsgard, Alexandru Potoco, Sebastian Urzendowsky, Dragos Bucur 
Rating: No we recommend for children under 12 years 


Synopsis: 
Building a blizzard at night to cover his tracks, seven prisoners, trapped in Stalin's reign of terror, escape from a Soviet gulag in Siberia in 1940. They are now free men, although almost certainly end up dead ... for the very long trek that awaits them to reach safe defies reasonable likelihood of a happy resolution and terrain to be crossed is relentless. 

With little equipment, no food, and without any certainty of their position or the direction to be followed, a journey that will force them to face great hardship and dramatic situations. Driven by their most basic animal instincts-survival and fear, but rather according to the most evolved human traits-compassion and confidence, the group will undergo experiences that transform, deep and terrible, anguished and ecstatic. 

Are governed at all times by a final principle: go ahead, go ahead, go ahead ... 

Production notes: 
Based on real events.
